struct timeval copyduration ( struct timeval  start_time,
struct timeval  end_time 
)

Returns the difference between the timestamps obtained just before and just after the call to the copying function The second parameter has to be a time later than the other.

Parameters:
start_time timestamp just before the copying function was called
end_time timestamp just after the copying function returns
Returns:
timeval struct which represents the difference of input structs, or NULL struct in case of error

char *  outfilename 
)

Copies one file to another using formatted I/O, one character at a time.

Parameters:
infilename Name of input file
outfilename Name of output file
Returns:
0 if successful, 1 if error.

char *  outfilename 
)

Copies one file to another using unformatted I/O, one character at a time.

Parameters:
infilename Name of input file
outfilename Name of output file
Returns:
0 if successful, 1 if error.

char *  outfilename,
int  bsize 
)

Copies one file to another using unformatted I/O, using buffer sizes.

Parameters:
infilename Name of input file
outfilename Name of output file
bsize Size of the buffer
Returns:
0 if successful, 1 if error.
